title: Episode 1
summary:
思源 frantically searches for his homework assignment that's due today. He looks everywhere in his bedroom but can't find it. Panicking, he asks 思琪 for help. Together they retrace his steps from yesterday afternoon - checking the living room where he had a snack, the dining room where the family ate dinner, and even the backyard where he played with his toy car. 思琪 teaches him that being organized is important and helps him develop a system.

Finally, 南珍 calls from the kitchen - she found the homework papers mixed in with yesterday's newspapers that she was about to recycle. 思源 is so relieved and grateful. 南珍 gently reminds him that everything needs its proper place. 思琪 suggests they make a special homework folder and designate one spot on the dining table as 思源's "homework corner."

The episode ends with 思源 happily putting his completed homework in his new folder and placing it in his backpack right away. He promises to always put his homework in the same place from now on. The gentle lesson reinforces the importance of organization, responsibility, and the value of family members helping each other solve problems.
